channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Researchers identify viral suspects that could be fueling long COVID
item.description: Scientists are uncovering a new possibility behind long COVID’s stubborn symptoms: hidden infections that awaken or emerge alongside SARS-CoV-2. Evide...

item.title: Researchers find how plants survive without sunlight or sex
item.description: The study reveals how Balanophora plants function despite abandoning photosynthesis and, in some species, sexual reproduction. Their plastid genomes s...

item.title: Scientists finally uncovered why the Indus Valley Civilization collapsed
item.description: A series of century-scale droughts may have quietly reshaped one of the world’s earliest urban civilizations. New climate reconstructions show that th...

item.title: Harvard gut discovery could change how we treat obesity and diabetes
item.description: Scientists found that certain molecules made by gut bacteria travel to the liver and help control how the body uses energy. These molecules change dep...

item.title: Male bonobos use hidden clues to boost mating success
item.description: Male bonobos have an impressive ability to detect when females are most fertile, even though the usual visual cues are unreliable. Researchers trackin...

item.title: NSF announces new initiative to launch and scale a new generation of transformative independent research organizations to advance breakthrough science
